Melbourne 19. April 1880
Circular letter to heads of 13 departments.
I have the honor to request that you will be so good as to furnish by the 24th instant an estimate of revenue and expenditure for your Department during the financial year 1880-81.

It is desired that the estimate referred to may be accompanied by (1) a statement of the reductions which it is proposed to effect in the expenditure and (2) a statement of the sums voted for the current financial year which it is estimated will not be required for expenditure.
You will also be so good as to furnish to the Honorable the Commissioner of Public Works any estimate for public works which may be required and send a copy of it to this office.
